p: We further investigated the heparin-binding of the EV-A71 variants. EV-A71 variants with VP1-145E (KKE, KEE and IEE) displayed significant reduction of 29.7%, 18.8% and 37.1% in heparin-binding, respectively ( Fig 1C). Similar findings were also observed in a heparin inhibition assay. Pre-treated heparin inhibition of these three VP1-145E variants significantly reduced RD cell viability to 51.5%, 45.5% and 34.3%, respectively ( Fig 1D). Based on these heparin-binding results, the EV-A71 variants were categorized into two groups: strong heparin binder (KEQ, KKQ and IEQ) and weak heparin binder (KKE, KEE and IEE).
